src:
Rašon Tomas MVP petog kola ABA lige
Košarkaš Partizana iza sebe ostavio Lensa Herisa i Nikolu Ivanovića

04 Nov 2019

Od samog starta sezone, Rašon Tomas ima posebno mesto u srcu navijača Partizana. Maestralni Amerikanac kako sezona odmiče samo nastavlja da oduševljava crno-belu publiku, a njegova partija protiv FMP-a danas je zvanično proglašena za najbolju u minulom kolu ABA lige.



Partizanov košarkaš je na meču protiv tima iz Železnika došao do čak 23 poena, pet skokova i dve asistencije, što je bilo dovoljno za ukupan indeks vredan 31. Na terenu je proveo 28 minuta, te je igrom svakako zasluženo poneo epitet najkorisnijeg igrača u regionalnom takmičenju.
Kako je naglašeno na zvaničnom sajtu ABA lige, Tomas je dobio nagradu pre svega zbog činjenice da je u najvažnijim trenucima uspeo da povede crno-bele do pobede protiv FMP-a, a ne isključivo zbog statističkih podataka.
Pored Rašona Tomasa, odlične partije su pružili Lens Heris za ekipu Primorske, kao i Nikola Ivanović za ekipu Budućnosti. Što se tiče pojedinačnih učinaka, najbolji strelac kola bio je Brajon Alen iz Zadra, koji je protiv Igokee postigao 24 poena, a najviše skokova uhvatio je Akos Keler, takođe iz Zadra (ukupno 11). Laskavu titulu najboljeg asistenta podelili su Žan-Mark Šiško iz Primorske i Stefan Pot iz FMP-a, upisavši po 12 asistencija, a najsupešniji „kradljivac“ bio je Rade Zagorac, koji je pet puta uzeo loptu košarkašima iz Železnika.




Foto: 
MN Press
text:
Rashon Thomas MVP of the fifth round of the ABA League
Partizan basketball player left Lance Heris and Nikola Ivanovic behind

04 Nov 2019

Right from the start of the season, Rashon Thomas has had a special place in the hearts of Partizan fans. The Maestral American as the season goes on continues to delight the black and white crowd, and his anti-FMP party has today been formally declared the best in the past round of the ABA League.



Partizan basketball scored up to 23 points, five rebounds and two assists in the match against the Zeleznik team, which was enough for a total index of 31. He spent 28 minutes on the field and certainly earned the title of most useful player in the regional competition. .
As highlighted on the official site of the ABA League, Thomas was awarded first and foremost for the fact that in the most important moments he was able to lead the black and white to victory against FMP, not solely because of statistics.
In addition to Rashon Thomas, Lance Heris for the Primorska team and Nikola Ivanovic for the Buducnost team provided excellent games. In terms of individual performance, the top scorer in the round was Brian Allen of Zadar, who scored 24 points against Igokea, with Akos Keller, also of Zadar (11 in total) catching the most rebounds. The flattering title of best assistant was shared by Jean-Marc Sisko from Primorska and Stefan Pot from FMP, who recorded 12 assists each, while the most successful "stealer" was Rade Zagorac, who took the ball to basketball players from Zeleznik five times.




Photo:
MN Press
